intro: Heterotheca mariana subsp. floridana, commonly known as the Florida blueweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early fall, producing clusters of small, blue-to-purple ray flowers. The species is notable for its adaptability to aquatic environments and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
